comments.body:
This says Agent has base as http.Agent
 https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-agent-base#agentfunction-callback-object-options--httpagent

Because of
https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-agent-base/blob/master/index.js#L43
I think that `extends http.Agent` is not correct

If I do this, you can call `agent.destory()`, but this method does not exist or is undefined
`typeof agent.destory === undefined`
Call back needs to be typed as per https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-agent-base#callbackhttpclientrequest-req-object-options-function-cb--undefined

I can not find any use of a third parameter cb, it is never used or called?!
I think the documentation is not very representative :/

And for the `AgentCallback#(req: any, ...)` I can add at most a few methods and properties that are used in the code
But I am not sure if that is effective
According to this options only have timeout as property : https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-agent-base#agentfunction-callback-object-options--httpagent

In this line [TooTallNate/node-agent-base/.../index.js#L41](https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-agent-base/blob/master/index.js#L41) you see that `opts` is passed to `this.options`

And in a line like this [TooTallNate/node-agent-base/.../index.js#L75](https://github.com/TooTallNate/node-agent-base/blob/master/index.js#L75) `opts.host` and `opts.path` are definitely used
